alert.note: Alert for Harris; Montgomery (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 1:53PM CST until January 30 at 1:00PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity for the following rivers in Texas... West Fork San Jacinto near Humble affecting Montgomery and Harris Counties. For the West Fork San Jacinto River...including Porter, Sendera Ranch Road, Conroe, Humble, Sheldon...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...West Fork San Jacinto near Humble. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 52.3 feet, Major lowland flooding begins as homes on Lake Lane West and Southshore Drive in the Belleau Woods subdivision begin flooding. Roads into the Treasure Cove subdivision are inundated and homes along Aqua Vista Drive threatened. Water is in many homes on Lake Point Drive in the Northshore subdivision. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 PM CST Thursday the stage was 51.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:45 PM CST Thursday was 51.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 52.4 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 49.3 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 52.4 feet on 01/08/1998. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun West Fork San Jacinto Humble 49.3 51.3 Thu 12 pm CS 52.4 51.9 50.8 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening.Friday morning at 800 AM CST.
